Title.evidence: The Carotid Revascularization, Endarterectomy vs. Stenting Trial (CREST): A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to CAS or CEA.

Participants.evidence: Participants with symptomatic carotid stenosis (≥50% by angiography, ≥70% by ultrasound) or asymptomatic stenosis (≥60% by angiography, ≥70% by ultrasound) were randomised 1:1 to CAS or CEA.

Intervention.evidence: comparing carotid artery stenting (CAS) to carotid endarterectomy (CEA)

Objective.evidence: CREST aims to provide insights into the efficacy of CAS versus CEA in preventing major cardiovascular events.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the composite of stroke, myocardial infarction, and all-cause mortality during a 30-day peri-procedural period, and ipsilateral stroke over up to 4 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment ensured.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 1,261 participants were randomised to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis approach was not specified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome results, effect size, and precision are not provided.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Sponsored by the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS).
